page.title: 01GENERAL SURVEY OF N.FAREHAM.
page.content: North Fareham lies between the town Fareham and Wickham village on undulating chalk/clay downland landscape,which forms a watershed between the rivers Wallington and Meon.It is a mixed farming area with small dairy herds and much arable land under cereals.Some vegetables are grown and there are a few horticulture smallholdings.20% of the land is forest with copses of deciduous trees .There are no large settlements,only dispersed farms and one small village, Funtley,of mainly nineteenth century cottages,population 500.The area is dissected by the main trunk route from Fareham to London,the A32.There is also a large mental institution called Knowle Hospital.
